intro: Periballanthus, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It consists of several species that are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their woody stems and aromatic leaves. The flowers are usually small and clustered, often displaying shades of white, pink, or purple. These plants thrive in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting well to sandy soils and low rainfall. Periballanthus species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
